x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ServiceNow Capabilities: Predictive Intelligence, Case Management, Integration Hub, Mobile Agent, Virtual Agent, Performance Analytics

 

Core Features:

  • Predictive Intelligence analyzes patient data (vitals, lab results, medical history, demographics) to generate risk scores for complications (preeclampsia, hemorrhage, eclampsia)
  • Case Management creates high-risk pregnancy cases with automated care protocols and milestone tracking
  • Mobile Agent enables community health workers to collect vitals and risk assessments during home visits in remote areas
  • Virtual Agent provides 24/7 pregnancy guidance, danger sign education, and emergency triage via SMS/WhatsApp for low-literacy populations
  • Integration Hub connects with electronic health records, lab systems, and national maternal health registries
  • Automated Alerts notify providers when risk scores exceed thresholds, triggering early intervention protocols
  • Performance Analytics tracks maternal outcomes, intervention effectiveness, and identifies high-risk geographic clusters

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Integration Hub for EHR/EMR systems, lab information systems, mobile health platforms
  • Predictive Intelligence trained on maternal health outcome datasets (WHO, local health data)
  • SMS/WhatsApp integration for low-connectivity areas
  • Offline mobile capability for remote community health workers
  • Multi-language support for diverse populations
  • HIPAA/GDPR compliance for health data privacy

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Training accurate AI models with limited historical data in developing regions, ensuring cultural sensitivity in pregnancy guidance, integrating with fragmented healthcare systems, and maintaining patient data privacy would probably the challenges in implementing this idea.
